$AAPL $SPY  a quick little talk on why timing and charting is useless when investing in the market, and why the majority of noobs on this forum predict 10 out of 1 “corrections”— here i have two simple Apple yearly charts pulled from my phone on yahoo finance so that anyone can see this too. what are the problems with the first chart???
1. the price range on the left is capped out near where the price is currently at, leaving no space on the screen and giving the impression that the candles are really large and extended on my *condensed* phone screen.
2. the time range on the bottom only shows up to this year and doesnt show any future years to come.
how do both of these problems contradict the stock market? the stock market is said to be FORWARD LOOKING. 
the second chart is a landscape view on my phone accounting for the future by simply extending the year and price range. Since Apple has hit 400 pre split, I set the price max to 500. see the difference???
$AAPL Looks like the tops in today….see ya next week!
